marketNews.title: â”¤ US Markets Plunge on Recession Fears
marketNews.content: US stock exchanges continued their decline, with the Nasdaq index down -4.8% WoW, S&P 500 -3.6% WoW, and DJIA -2.6% WoW as of Tuesday (11/3). This drop continues the downward trend in US stock markets that has been ongoing for the previous 2 weeks, driven by investor concerns over potential US recession due to the trade war. The Chief Economist at Moody's Analytics, Mark Zandi, told ABC News that his firm has now raised the probability of a US recession to 35%. In response to the decline in US stock markets, US President Donald Trump said on Tuesday (11/3) that people cannot just look at the capital market, a statement contrary to Trump's tendency to use stock market rallies as proof of his success. Trump also warned of potential turmoil during the "transition period" of his tenure, as his administration aims to do "something big" to bring wealth back to the US. Trump himself frequently alternates in implementing his tariff policies, which trigger global market uncertainty. Most recently, Trump on Tuesday (11/3) threatened to double import tariffs on Canadian steel and aluminum commodities to 50% after the province of Ontario in Canada announced plans to impose an additional charge on electricity sent to the US. The discussion to double these import tariffs was then canceled by Trump just hours after it was announced, following the cancellation of the Ontario authorities imposing an additional charge on electricity shipments to the US. Meanwhile, the European Union announced today, Wednesday (12/3), that the region will immediately implement retaliatory tariffs against US imports worth 28 billion US dollars. This step follows the US government's action to impose a 25% import tariff on steel and aluminum commodities as of today. The European Union stated that they will end the suspension of import tariffs for the US covering the 2018-2020 period on April 1, 2025, and will impose full import tariffs on the US starting April 13, 2025, but they remain open to negotiation as they believe higher import tariffs will not benefit anyone.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: The risk of a US economic recession potentially pressures the global economy, which could negatively impact Indonesia's trade balance due to declining exports. On the other hand, a worsening US economy could open greater room for The Fed to lower US interest rates, which could be followed by a reduction in the BI Rate by Bank Indonesia. The prospect of a Fed interest rate cut has increased recently, where analysis from the CME FedWatch Tool shows that the probability of a US interest rate cut of more than 50 bps by the end of 2025 rose to 65.8% as of today from 60.9% a week ago. Furthermore, the worsening US economic outlook could cause an outflow from that country to other countries offering better economic growth prospects.

marketNews.title: State Budget Deficit Reaches 0.1% of GDP in January 2025, Revenue Realization Falls Sharply YoY
marketNews.content: Bisnis reports that the State Budget (APBN) deficit reached 0.1% of GDP as of January 2025 (vs. Jan 2024: 0.16% surplus of GDP, 2025 APBN target: 2.53% deficit of GDP), based on documents released on the Ministry of Finance website today, Wednesday (12/3). Bisnis reports that the document was no longer available on the Ministry of Finance website as of this afternoon, but the media successfully took a screenshot of the document. Based on the screenshot compiled by Bisnis, the realization of state revenue as of January 2025 fell -28.3% YoY to 157.32 trillion rupiah, fulfilling only 5.24% of the 2025 APBN target. Meanwhile, the realization of state spending as of January 2025 fell -1.9% YoY to 180.77 trillion rupiah, equivalent to 4.99% of the 2025 APBN target. This result caused the primary balance surplus to decline to 10.61 trillion rupiah (vs. Jan 2024: 65.25 trillion rupiah surplus, 2025 APBN target: 63.33 trillion rupiah deficit). Bloomberg reports that the Minister of Finance, Sri Mulyani, will hold a briefing on the 2025 APBN performance on Thursday (13/3). This briefing will provide an update on the January 2025 APBN performance, which is highly anticipated by the market amidst the government's budget restructuring early this year. The Ministry of Finance usually announces the APBN performance realization 2-3 weeks after the end of the previous month, but the briefing regarding the January 2025 APBN performance has not yet been held due to a busy schedule. On Wednesday (12/3), Bisnis reported that the Ministry of Finance had uploaded documents related to the January 2025 APBN performance, but the documents were subsequently unavailable this afternoon on the same day. The Minister of Manpower, Yassierli, stated on Tuesday (11/3) that the government proposes that the holiday allowance (THR) for online motorcycle taxi (ojol) partners amounts to at least 20% of the partners' average net monthly income over the last 12 months. Yassierli also mentioned that the government requests ride-hailing companies - including GoTo Gojek Tokopedia ($GOTO) and Grab Holdings Ltd. (Nasdaq: GRAB) - to provide THR for ojol partners in cash, not in kind or other forms. Yassierli also ordered private and State-Owned Enterprises (BUMN) companies to disburse THR at least 7 days before (H-7) Eid al-Fitr 2025, with full payment and no installment options.

marketNews.title: Government to Revise TNI Law, Expanding Civilian Posts for TNI Personnel
marketNews.content: The government and the DPR agreed on Tuesday (11/3) to revise Law No. 34/2004 concerning the TNI, with the discussion of the regulation's amendment focusing on expanding civilian positions for TNI personnel from the current 10 ministries/agencies to 15 ministries/agencies. The Minister of Defense, Sjafrie Sjamsoeddin, stated that the draft amendment to the TNI Law requires military personnel to first resign from the TNI before filling a civilian position. According to DPR member TB Hasanuddin, the new draft changed from the previous draft which allowed active TNI personnel to fill any government position. This TNI Law revision emerges amidst a trend of placing active and retired TNI officers in State-Owned Enterprises (BUMN) during President Prabowo Subianto's tenure. Early this month, Tempo reported that President Prabowo gathered hundreds of TNI colonels in Hambalang, West Java, to receive courses from SBM ITB, FEB UI, and Prasetya Mulya University. Tempo reported that these officers have the potential to occupy managerial positions in BUMN and BUMD. Bank Indonesia estimates that retail sales will contract by -0.5% YoY in February 2025, although they are still projected to grow +0.8% MoM in line with preparations for Ramadan and Eid al-Fitr. The annual decline in retail sales in February 2025 is expected to be driven by a decrease in the food, beverage, and tobacco group, although the information and communication equipment group, apparel sub-group, and motor vehicle fuel group are expected to increase. Meanwhile, the realization of retail sales in January 2025 slowed to +0.5% YoY (vs. Dec 2024: +1.8% YoY) and contracted -4.7% MoM (vs. Dec 2024: +5.9% MoM). The monthly contraction in retail sales in January 2025 is in line with normalization after the Christmas and New Year celebrations, which caused a sales contraction in most groups, except for spare parts and accessories. The Government will impose anti-dumping import duties (BMAD) on nylon products from China, Thailand, and Taiwan starting March 25, 2025, based on the latest regulation published on Wednesday (12/3). This policy will be effective for the next 4 years, with import duties ranging from 1,254 to 31,510 rupiah per kg. The BMAD rule emerged after the investigation by the Indonesian Anti-Dumping Committee found that nylon products from these countries had caused losses to the domestic industry. Nylon is used in food and industrial packaging, pharmaceuticals, electronics, and textiles.

tickerNews.title: BBCA: CEO Replaced, Final Dividend Yield Indication at 2.7%
tickerNews.content: Shareholders of Bank Central Asia approved the proposed replacement of the board of directors and commissioners today, Wednesday (12/3), with Gregory Hendra Lembong becoming President Director, replacing Jahja Setiaatmadja who was appointed as President Commissioner. The plan for changes in the board of directors and commissioners was announced by the company in February 2025. Furthermore, the GMS also approved the distribution of dividends for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to approximately 37 trillion rupiah, equivalent to a 67.4% dividend payout ratio (vs. 2023: 68.4%). This amount indicates a final dividend of 250 rupiah per share with a dividend yield of 2.7%, based on BBCA's closing share price on Wednesday (12/3) at 9,125 rupiah per share. The cum date and final dividend payment date have not yet been announced. Previously, BBCA distributed an interim dividend for the 2024 fiscal year of 50 rupiah per share in December 2024.

tickerNews.title: GOTO Records Positive Pro-forma Adjusted EBITDA in 4Q24, Net Loss Narrows Significantly
tickerNews.content: GoTo Gojek Tokopedia recorded positive pro-forma adjusted EBITDA of 399 billion rupiah in 4Q24 (vs. 4Q23: positive 89 billion rupiah, 3Q24: positive 137 billion rupiah). This result brought the adjusted EBITDA for 2024 to a positive 386 billion rupiah (vs. 2023: negative 2.3 trillion rupiah), exceeding the company's guidance targeting break-even. On the bottom line, the net loss narrowed to 1.1 trillion rupiah in 4Q24 (vs. 4Q23: net loss 80.4 trillion rupiah, 3Q24: net loss 655 billion rupiah), resulting in a full-year 2024 net loss of 3.1 trillion rupiah (vs. 2023: net loss 87 trillion rupiah).

tickerNews.title: RATU Reports Net Profit of $13.9 Million in 2024, Down 43% YoY Due to Higher Cost of Revenue
tickerNews.content: Raharja Energi Cepu recorded a net profit of 13.9 million US dollars during 2024 (-43% YoY). The decrease in net profit was caused by a surge in cost of revenue (+74% YoY) growing higher than revenue growth (+23% YoY), causing the gross profit margin to fall to 38.9% (vs. 2023: 56.8%). The increase in the cost of revenue was primarily driven by an increase in oil and gas lifting costs (+81% YoY). Additionally, the decline in RATU's net profit during 2024 was also pressured by weaker profit from associated entities - originating from the Cepu block - which decreased by -18% YoY to 6.2 million US dollars.

tickerNews.title: ASII Car Wholesale Sales Decline 6.5% YoY in February 2025, Market Share Drops to 53.3%
tickerNews.content: Astra International recorded car wholesale sales of 38,546 units in February 2025 (-6.5% YoY, +12% MoM), underperforming the industry average (+2.2% YoY, +17% MoM). Consequently, ASII's market share fell to 53.3% in February 2025 (vs. February 2024: 58.3%, January 2025: 55.8%). ASII's car wholesales in February 2025 were supported by an increase in Toyota+Lexus sales to 24,506 units (+3.3% YoY, +11% MoM), while Daihatsu sales declined to 11,959 units (-21% YoY, +20% MoM). For 2M25, ASII's wholesale sales dropped to 73,077 units (-7.8% YoY), with market share falling to 54.4% (vs. 2M24: 56.4%, 1M25: 55.8%).

tickerNews.title: PGAS Offers Upstream Oil and Gas Business to Pertamina Hulu Energi; Plans to Divest Muriah Block
tickerNews.content: The President Director of Perusahaan Gas Negara, Arief Setiawan Handoko, stated in a meeting with the DPR on Wednesday (12/3) that his company is offering its upstream oil and gas business, PT Saka Energi Indonesia, to PT Pertamina Hulu Energi. However, Arief mentioned that this offer has not yet been accepted by PT Pertamina Hulu Energi. Business reports state that PT Saka Energi Indonesia currently manages 11 oil and gas blocks, consisting of 6 producing blocks and 5 exploration blocks. Additionally, Arief also stated that PGAS plans to divest the Muriah block - one of the oil and gas blocks owned by PT Saka Energi Indonesia - although he did not elaborate further. Arief explained that PGAS initially planned to return the block to the government as its management contract would expire in December 2026, but the company recently received offers from potential buyers.

tickerNews.title: DILD Targets 2 Trillion Rupiah Marketing Sales in 2025, Cautious Capex Allocation
tickerNews.content: The Director of Intiland Development, Archied Noto Pradono, stated that the company targets marketing sales of 2 trillion rupiah throughout 2025, equivalent to the 2024 target and +25% higher than the 2024 realization of 1.6 trillion rupiah. Kontan previously reported that DILD had communicated the possibility of adopting a conservative strategy in 2025, considering the weakening purchasing power of the middle class. DILD allocated a capex of 120 billion rupiah in 2025 (vs. 2024 capex allocation: 1 trillion rupiah), intended for consolidating several of the company's industrial land areas, such as in Batang, Central Java, and Ngoro, East Java.

tickerNews.title: RMKE Targets 2025 Net Profit Growth of +62.5% YoY to 446.7 Billion Rupiah, Supported by New Clients and Infrastructure Projects
tickerNews.content: The President Director of RMK Energy, Vincent Saputra, stated that the company targets net profit growth of +62.5% YoY during 2025 to reach 446.7 billion rupiah, with a revenue growth target of +58.5% YoY to 3.9 trillion rupiah. Operationally, RMKE targets coal loading growth of +24.1% YoY to 11.2 million tons in 2025, and coal sales growth is targeted to rise +35.4% YoY to 3.8 million tons. Vincent mentioned that these targets are supported by the addition of 2 new customers and ongoing projects by the company, such as the construction of a hauling road connected to Bukit Asam's operational area ($PTBA), new container yard investment at the Gunung Megang loading and unloading station in Muara Enim, and an increase in the capacity of the loading and unloading station at Simpang, South Sumatra.

tickerNews.title: SMLE Controller Sells 100 Million Shares, Ownership Drops to 73.12%
tickerNews.content: The Controller of Sinergi Multi Lestarindo, PT Sinergi Asia Corporindo, sold 100 million SMLE shares at a price of 85 rupiah per share on March 5, 2025. The total transaction value reached 8.5 billion rupiah. After this transaction, the ownership of PT Sinergi Asia Corporindo in SMLE decreased from 77.42% to 73.12%.

The total transaction value reached approximately 3.9 billion rupiah. After this transaction, the ownership of IMR Asia Holding Pte. Ltd. in FORU decreased from 77.33% to 76.81%.
